meanings.definition: Orienteeers (verb): to participate in the sport of orienteering
meanings.sent1: Every weekend, the family orienteers through the forest, enjoying the challenge of finding hidden markers.
meanings.sent2: She orients herself carefully before orienteering to ensure she doesn't get lost in the woods.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to orienteers around the house, pretending to search for a hidden treasure.
meanings.sent4: His mind orients like a compass needle, always pointing towards the thrill of orienteering.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the wind through the trees orients her, guiding her as she orients through the course.

meanings.definition: Orienteeers (noun): individuals who participate in the sport of orienteering
meanings.sent1: The orienteers gathered at the starting line, eager to begin the race through the wilderness.
meanings.sent2: She met other orienteers at the event, sharing stories of their adventures in the sport.
meanings.sent3: The group of orienteers looked like a team of explorers, ready to conquer any challenge.
meanings.sent4: In the world of orienteering, the orienteers are the true masters of navigation and strategy.
meanings.sent5: The community of orienteers supports each other, sharing tips and tricks for successful orienteering.
